title: Is BA Economics (hons) worth doing from Amity University? - Quora

response.answer_text: Economics is an evolving discipline that covers many aspects of our everyday lives. The study of people in the ordinary business of life is an accepted definition. Why do prices rise? Why do countries trade? Why did India demonetize 500 and 1000 rupee notes? Such questions require knowledge of economics if we are to understand the complexities. Complete knowledge can be gained through a brilliantly designed programme and a reputed college or institute. Amity University has a strong academic presence and the course is aimed to give thorough economic concepts added with analytical methods of Economics. It also provides you with the opportunity to pursue courses that emphasize quantitative and theoretical aspects of Economics. You’ll also get equal exposure of corporate functioning/professional world through the summer internship program and term papers. Amongst AMITY, you may also consider JSGP i.e. Jindal School of Government and Public Policy, Haryana. Their courses are also intelligently designed by topmost academicians and skilled faculty. In 2018, JGU broke into the QS Asia University Rankings 2019. JGU is the youngest Indian university to break into this prestigious international ranking. Through the three years, you’ll develop your writing, reading, speaking and presentation skills during the program. Building upon the foundation laid in the first two years in economics and quantitative courses, you can choose from a wide variety of elective courses and specializations in your third year. So choose wisely for a greatly successful career. Hope this information gives you clarity. Best of Luck…!!!
